BR_text.BRsummary: Segmentation fault when ImageAcquisitionManager is created and quit() is called in interpreter
BR_text.BRdescription:
Describe the bug
 When Harvester is initialized and ImageAcquisitionManager is created, exiting the interpreter causes a segmentation fault.
 To Reproduce
 Simply the following code in the interpreter will do:
 <denchmark-code>>>> from harvesters.core import Harvester
 >>> h = Harvester()
 >>> h.add_cti_file("/path/to/cti_file")
 >>> h.update_device_info_list()
 >>> iam = h.create_image_acquisition_manager(0)
 >>> quit()
 Segmentation fault
 </denchmark-code>
 
 Expected behavior
 Python interpreter should be able exit without the segmentation fault.
 Desktop (please complete the following information):
 
 OS: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.4

comments_5.comment_text: It's not necessary to try today but I would like to introduce you how to log the execution of Harvester. I'll attach a logging configuration file but please assume you have already got the file and its name is logging.report.ini. Just copying the file, you will tell Harvester the location where the configuration file is located using an environment variable HARVESTER_LOGGING_CONFIG. To setup the environment variable, just type export HARVESTER_LOGGING_CONFIG=path/to/logging.report.ini. Then you launch your interpreter. In the meantime, you'll see logging messages every code execution. I'll show you a block that I excepted from the example code you introduced.
